pullRequest.title: Bugfix for an NPE that occured when using the split nodes plugin
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description of the Change
The split nodes plugin would throw an NPE 100% of the time when I used it on master. When updating the split nodes plugin with the new feature, @Auriga2 would experience this issue on occasion. The NPE occurs because when getting the splitParameters.get(SPLIT_PARAMETER_ID) we only checked if the parameter was null but not the string value so the string value could still return null. There is no associated ticket for this issue.
java.lang.NullPointerException
at java.base/java.lang.String.contains(String.java:2036)
at au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.views.dataaccess.plugins.clean.SplitNodesPlugin.query(SplitNodesPlugin.java:192)
[catch] at au.gov.asd.tac.constellation.views.dataaccess.templates.RecordStoreQueryPlugin.lambda$query$0(RecordStoreQueryPlugin.java:139)
at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:264)
at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)

Alternate Designs

nodes.bodyText:
I would just add this condition to the old tertiary operator.
i.e. final String character = splitParameters.get(SPLIT_PARAMETER_ID) != null && splitParameters.get(SPLIT_PARAMETER_ID).getStringValue() != null ? ...
